App Intro: Distributed compute layer for A2V agents.
App Detail: NodeNet orchestrates A2V workloads across a decentralized mesh of GPU and CPU nodes. Each agent request is scheduled based on latency, energy efficiency, and cost metrics. Tasks are verified via manifest hashing and billed automatically through x402. Enterprises and research labs use NodeNet to deploy large-scale, trust-minimized AI clusters with built-in accountability.

App Intro: Edge-compute runtime for lightweight AI services.
App Detail: EdgeMesh brings A2V micro-agents to local and IoT environments. It auto-deploys compute tasks to the nearest available node, synchronizing manifests and results via MCP channels. The network supports disconnected operation, caching, and delayed x402 settlements for offline devices. Perfect for robotics, logistics, and real-world sensing applications.

ValueNet handles all inter-agent value transfers across A2V networks. It batches micropayments, validates proofs, and maintains compliance-ready settlement logs. With an average latency under 1s and negligible cost per tx, ValueNet is the financial spine of the A2V economy. It supports both fiat gateways and crypto-denominated tokens.

App Intro: Distributed object and vector storage for A2V workloads.
App Detail: AetherDB provides persistent storage for manifests, embeddings, and large datasets. Its hybrid structure combines IPFS and Postgres-compatible indexing to ensure queryability. Each stored asset carries an A2V hash signature, while x402 handles usage-based pricing. It's optimized for agent memory recall and long-term provenance archiving.

App Intro: Interoperability bridge between A2V, MCP, and A2A.
App Detail: MCPRelay routes protocol messages and maintains compatibility across multiple AI ecosystems. It translates manifests, normalizes headers, and enforces schema equivalence. Developers rely on MCPRelay to connect agents written for older MCP networks with the new A2V value protocol stack.

App Intro: Real-time data routing fabric for multi-tenant AI systems.
App Detail: DataLinker abstracts multiple data sources — chain logs, APIs, databases — into streamable manifests. Agents can subscribe, filter, and replay data directly into their reasoning pipelines. With x402 tracking, each data access event generates transparent micropayments to the original provider.

App Intro: Multi-cloud orchestration and auto-scaling for A2V workloads.
App Detail: AIGrid enables auto-scaling deployment of A2V agents across AWS, Aliyun, and decentralized compute pools. It continuously monitors resource utilization and reallocates jobs for optimal performance and cost. Its integration with x402 makes compute billing instant and transparent, while manifests ensure deterministic task reproducibility.

App Intro: Immutable operational audit and telemetry ledger.
App Detail: LogiChain logs every A2V agent operation — from task initialization to payment settlement — into a tamper-proof ledger. Enterprises use it to meet compliance and traceability requirements. Its integration with ValueNet ensures financial and operational proofs are unified into one transparent audit trail.

App Intro: Low-latency communication layer for agent messaging.
App Detail: SynapseNet manages encrypted message routing and adaptive bandwidth control between agents across regions. It reduces latency using adaptive multiplexing and verifies each message via A2V manifest stamps. Deployed widely in trading and robotics contexts, it forms the neural fabric of A2V's global agent communication stack.

CorePulse continuously tracks node health, performance throughput, and manifest sync frequency. It detects network degradation and triggers self-healing protocols across A2V edge clusters. All operational data is logged in AetherDB and linked to x402 billing events for transparent SLA tracking.
